title: Knock-ups being unaffected by tenacity is poor design, considering how prevalent they are.
body: The number of instant-cast, AOE knockups is far too great for there to be no itemization available to mitigate their effects. Period. We are playing a much different game than we were when Tenacity was designed, the amount of CC that is unaffected by Tenacity is staggering, and it's time to at the very least TEST adding knockups to the list of CC effects reduced by Tenacity on PBE and see how it pans out.

replies.body: Knockups exist _because_ they aren't affected by Tenacity, not in spite of that. Most CC has to be balanced around use against champions with as well as without Tenacity, similar to how heals might be used on champions with or without Grievous Wounds. Knockups don't last as long as other CC due to this consistency.
If the duration of a displacement is long enough to blow a champion up ( which it is) then there is no difference between that and conventional cc

That's because displacements are more dynamic than stuns/roots.
How do you use tenacity on maoki's knockback? It's duration is tiny already and how does it effect the displacment's range? Do you suggest a tenacity stacked champion (like garen) will just barely move? That will completley break maoki (for the worse) and he will require compensation buffs.

Draven's E, Taliyah's knock back, Syndra's scatter, vel'koz E - and many other similar spells were balanced without tenacity in mind, they are balanced around themselves no matter the opposition, so if any knockup is strong, it should be looked at individually.
Again, the issue is not the power level of any individual displacement effect, but the number of them overall.

What's the average duration of a displacement compared on a stun?

Ashe even has a 3.5s stun, the longest knock-up has to be like 1.5s.

Displacements are balanced around having no counter, but having short duration, suppressions are balanced around the user not being able to move or act in any way while their target is suppressed.
Thats not very short considering  the current time to kill is 2 seconds.

I think like surpression, it has more to do with the users design rather than the knock up concept.

For instance, tenacity doesn't affect malzahar or skarner because the CC is based on their spells themselves rather then how much you cancel them.

Two examples that come to mind for knockups/displacements are thresh and blitz, which wouldn't  pull properly if the duration wasn't exact. Even sylas has a whole animation built around landing his and pulling himself in.

I feel they need to add more subcategories to knockups and displacements, ones that can be reduced by tenacity (cho Q, Galio ult, malphite ult, etc, stuff that seems obvious) and ones that shouldnt be for gameplay purposes (or balance).

(and knockbacks) 



Yea this is another one of those balancing messes, sometimes I would run towards the nearest wall and HOPE vayne e`s me into it since the stun is so short compared to the distance I would have to walk (if im stacking tenacity that is)
